intro: Onosma forrestii, commonly known as the Himalayan sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh mountain conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Onosma forrestii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
